event_description:
Getting Ahead on Your Personal Finances

Learn how to achieve your personal financial goals (THIS IS A 5-SESSION COURSE)
This workshop will provide a basic overview of how to manage one’s personal finances. It is designed to empower individuals to take control of their financial lives and to give individuals the tools needed to achieve their financial goals.  Total course hours: 5 sessions, once a week for two hours each session. 
You will learn about: 
• Developing a long-term wealth building goal• Starting saving for the future• Developing a Financial Action Plan• Starting an emergency fund• How to view credit report and start building/repairing credit

event_description:
The Food Business Pathways (FBP) Program will graduate its sixth cohort on Thursday, July 20 from 5:30 pm – 8:00 pm at NYC Housing Authority.
The FBP Program is designed exclusively for NYCHA residents who want to start or grow their food businesses. Please join us as we highlight this milestone in our graduates’ entrepreneurial journey.
The graduation ceremony will be followed by a buffet-style dinner catered by some of our past FBP graduates.
Food Business Pathways is made possible by Citi Community Development and is a partnership between the NYC Department of Small Business Services (SBS), NYCHA’s Office of Resident Economic Empowerment & Sustainability (REES), Start Small Think Big (SSTB), Hot Bread Kitchen (HBK), and New York City Economic Development Corporation (NYCEDC).
event_name: Food Business Pathways: Cohort 6 Graduation

event_description:
The City of New York spends up to $17 billion per year on goods and services. Getting certified as a Minority and/or Woman-Owned Business Enterprise (M/WBE) will help you compete for these opportunities and access exclusive programs to help your small business grow. More than 5,000 businesses currently benefit from New York City certification, and the de Blasio administration is committed to:


Awarding $16 billion in City contracts to M/WBEs by 2025
Awarding 30 percent of the value of City contracts to M/WBEs by 2021
Increasing the number of City-certified M/WBEs to 9,000 by 2019


Join us to learn how to apply for certification and access free programs and services for your business at an information session hosted in partnership with:

U.S. Representative Grace Meng (Honorary Host)
NYC Council Member Peter Koo
Queens Economic Development Corporation
Flushing BID
event_name: M/WBE Certification Information Session

event_description:
Seeking financing to start or grow your small business in NYC?  Apply to “Jumpstart Your Business” and let NYC Business Solutions assist!
NYC Business Solutions and Kiva Zip, a non-profit organization, have collaborated to help NYC entrepreneurs receive a zero-interest loan of up to $10,000.  Kiva Zip provides a unique platform, which combines the benefits of alternative crowdfunding and micro-financing options.  Approved applicants will work one-on-one with a NYC Business Solutions Account Manager.

Kiva Zip Loan Highlights:                        
          - Zero interest          
          - Zero Fees
          - Loans up to $10,000
 
Please register to apply.  Once registered, NYC Business Solutions will e-mail you a pre-application. 
PLEASE NOTE: This is not a class/event.
A one-on-one session will only be scheduled if your pre-application is approved.
event_name: Jumpstart Your business - Finance your small business in NYC with a zero-interest loan!

event_description:
¡Conozca lo que se requiere para iniciar su propio negocio! 
Este curso proporciona una descripción general básica de los pasos para iniciar un negocio. Aprenda cómo NYC Business Solutions lo puede guiar en cada paso a lo largo del camino. 
Usted aprenderá acerca de:• Cómo desarrollar un plan de negocio • Cómo determinar su estructura legal • Cómo configurar su contabilidad • Cómo obtener permisos y licencias • Cómo obtener financiamiento

NYC Business Solutions, el centro de soluciones para pequeñas empresas de la ciudad de nueva york se ha asociado con el Centro de Negocios para Nuevos Americanos.
El Centro de Negocios para Nuevos Americanos está orgulloso de ayudar a los neoyorquinos en su camino hacia el sueño americano de obtener independencia financiera y ser dueño de su propio hogar; proporcionándoles información y apoyo para prosperar financieramente.
Desde el 1998, hemos aprobado más de $17.6 millones de dólares en micro-préstamos que comienzan desde $500 hasta $50,000 para empezar o expander su negocio. Nos especializamos en trabajar con empresarios inmigrantes y refugiados
event_name: 10 Pasos Para Iniciar Su Propio Negocio (10 Steps Spanish), Queens 7/25/2017

event_description:
Smart business owners know that they need to have a good understanding of their business’s finances in order to succeed.
During this workshop, brought in partnership with TruFund’s Financial Empowerment Program, you will gain critical insight into understanding business financial statements and how they can inform you to make smart financial and management decisions.  We will also discuss the importance of proper cash flow planning and tools to assist with the tracking of inflows and outflows of cash. An effective cash flow system will help you manage funds to cover operational costs, bills and help you foresee potential problems in the future.
All of this will better inform you and assist you as you seek capital for growing your business.
Join us for this very insightful program!

Seminar length: 2 hours
event_name: Show Me The Money: Financial Statements and Profit, Queens, 7/27/17

event_description:
Great, so you have a permanent home on the internet, and some “friends” as well.  Now what? 
If you consider yourself a pretty digitally savvy business owner, you’ve probably built a website for your business, and are working to grow your social media audience.  These are great first steps in managing your overall web presence.  However, there are additional web tools that can help you expand and scale your business online.  This course will explore ways that advanced online tools, such as e-commerce platforms, online advertising, and content management products, can help enhance interactions with your customer-base, and better reach new consumers.
You will learn about:

In-depth explanation of strategies and techniques for specific social networks
Content management tools and key products
E-Commerce (products and pros/cons)
Digital/mobile payments
Online advertising
How to enhance your business’s primary/preferred social network

This special edition of Restaurant Management Bootcamp will help aspiring restaurateurs gain a deeper understanding in the operations to get your restaurant up and running.  The course will provide an overview of the restaurant business in NYC, and will cover ten basic points that must be taken into account by anyone who wants to open a successful food service business.

event_description:
Learn how the government can become your customer!
Each and every day, the government buys billions of dollars' worth of goods and services from small businesses. The Selling to Government workshop offers an introduction to government contracting and prepares businesses to find opportunities in their area of expertise. Come and learn how your business can pursue contracts at the City, State, and Federal government levels.
What you will learn:

Understanding contract sizes
Determining the right small business program for your business
Registering your business with different government entities
Identifying government contracting opportunities
Developing your capability statement
Marketing your business to the government

 
REGISTER NOW!
ticket_description: There will be no admittance to the workshop after 10:45 A.M.
event_name: Selling to Government, 8/8/17

event_description:
Minority & Women-Owned Business Enterprise (M/WBE) Certification Workshop
If you want to do business with the government, getting certified as a Minority & Women-Owned Business Enterprise (M/WBE) can help you to accomplish that goal! Getting certified as a Minority & Women-Owned Business Enterprise (M/WBE) gives you exclusive access to opportunities to sell to government, networking events, inclusion in the City's Online Directory of Certified Businesses and offers many other benefits.
Join us for a workshop that will walk you through the process for completing your M/WBE application. Total course hours: 1 session, 2 hours.
You will learn about:

Getting certified as an M/WBE with New York City, New York State, NYC School Construction Authority, and The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
Applying for a vendor number and get notified of government opportunities in your industry
Completing your M/WBE application the right way
Working with an account manager to review your application for completeness before submitting it to an analyst for approval
event_name: Getting Certified as a Minority & Women-Owned Business (M/WBE) Workshop, Queens, 8/16/2017

Small Business Digital Marketing 
Looking to jumpstart your sales? Our digital marketing wizard will teach you how to attract and keep customers!
This workshop will teach entrepreneurs how to use digital marketing to make their businesses more visible and improve customer retention. Specifically, the course will provide strategies on how to increase your brand’s online visibility and improve the customer shopping experience. event_description:
Looking for talent?
Do you  need to hire immediately to ensure your small business success in 2017?
If you’re opening a new location, expanding your operations, or just getting started, NYC Business Solutions can help you find and cultivate the right talent — for free.
We’ll not only save you money, but also time, by helping you hire the right employees. Whether you have a staff of 1 or 125, NYC Business Solutions can work for you.
We provide qualified and pre-screened candidates. We’ll recruit and screen job-seekers from a citywide pool of thousands of candidates, and refer the most qualified to your business. All free of charge.
  

 To get started register today or contact Shin Otake at sotake@nycbusiness-solutions.com 

 
We’ll coordinate with you to advertise your open positions. We’ll also handle the work of scheduling interviews and can provide free interview space in Queens. 
If you need : 


Administrative / Office Assistants


Retail Staff


Cashiers


Receptionists


Servers and Bartenders


Maintenance Workers / Porters


Housekeepers / Residential Cleaners


Social Services


IT Helpdesk


Security Guards


 
 We make it turnkey for the small business owner.  All free of charge.
 

 To get started register today or contact Shin Otake at sotake@nycbusiness-solutions.com
event_name: Small Business Owners: Stress-Free Hiring

event_description:
Finding Finance - Open Hours
Today, as always, running a small business in NYC is no easy feat.   As the business owner you are tackling all kinds of issues facing your business.
One of the most challenging issues is finding financing to support and grow your business.  We have Financial Counselors on staff who will guide you through every step of obtaining the needed funding. 
Whether it’s $500 - $500,000, we have the right resource for you.  We have assisted thousands of clients in obtaining the dollars they needed to ensure they have a thriving business.
We can help with:

Securing a loan


Acquiring a line of credit


Creating financial projections


Obtaining an interest free-microloan


Rebuilding your personal credit

And we do this all for FREE!!
NYC Business Solutions Centers are small businesses’ trusted advisors.  Simply register and we will contact you to set up an appointment to meet with our Finance expert.
event_name: Get Financing for your Business

event_description:
If you have a retail storefront in Queens this is the course for you to attend!  
NYC’s Compliance Advisor team will be here to provide insight into city regulations and how to avoid costly fines. This includes regulatory assistance, like street maintenance, signage, license /permits, assisting with resolving violations, and any emergencies that interfere with your business.
After the class we can arrange for Compliance Advisors to visit your location and  provide on-site education about how to avoid common violations issued from Dept of Health, Consumer Affairs, Sanitation, Environmental Protection, Fire Dept (among others).
There will be no enforcement action or fines issued from our Advisors.
The  free consultation will include a tailored checklist that addresses your businesses specific needs and inquiries, supplemental information, and important feedback.

event_description:
Jumpstart Your Business – Obtain Small business Financing Through This Unique Workshop Opportunity
For small businesses, access to capital is one of the primary barriers to growth. In recent years, some entrepreneurs have turned to "crowdfunding" to bring their business ideas to the next level. But not everyone has an extensive personal network to market their fundraising campaign.
The NYC Business Solutions: “Jumpstart your Business” workshop guides entrepreneurs towards capital with no interest, fees, or credit score requirements. NYC Business Solutions does so by collaborating with Kiva Zip, a non-profit organization, which functions as a hybrid version of a crowdfunding and microfinance platform. By ‘registering’ for this event, you are expressing interest in applying to be a part of this workshop. 
In this class you will: 

Learn about kiva zip
Have time to plan or take a compelling photo
Receive tips and tricks for having a successful campaign.
Have opportunity after the info session to put together a kiva zip story and get feedback
event_name: Kiva Zip Bootcamp – Obtain Small Business Financing Through This Unique Workshop Opportunity, Brooklyn 8/24/17

Great, so you have a permanent home on the internet, and some “friends” as well.  Now what? If you consider yourself a pretty digitally savvy business owner, you’ve probably built a website for your business, and are working to grow your social media audience.  These are great first steps in managing your overall web presence.  However, there are additional web tools that can help you expand and scale your business online.  This course will explore ways that advanced online tools, such as e-commerce platforms, online advertising, and content management products, can help enhance interactions with your customer-base, and better reach new consumers.

HR Tools for the Small Business Owner
To be a successful small-business owner, you must master the art of juggling. Owning and managing a small business means having to take on multiple roles, from accounting to marketing to human resources. Unfortunately, it’s easy for small-business owners to sometimes ignore the human resources side of business. 


The goal of the workshop is to provide details about how HR issues can impact a small business, such as what actions will keep a business out of HR legal trouble and what initiatives can create a positive work environment that lowers employee turnover.

We will review:


Laws covering the hiring process


Job posting and sourcing


References and background checks


Typical pitfalls to avoid in the hiring process 




We will also discuss how as a small business owner you can offer yourself and staff a vast array of HR benefits, with little oversite.
event_name: HR Tools for the Small Business Owner, Queens 9/7/17

event_description:
Minority & Women-Owned Business Enterprise (M/WBE) Certification - WEBINAR
If you want to do business with the government, getting certified as a Minority & Women-Owned Business Enterprise (M/WBE) can help you to accomplish that goal! Getting certified as a Minority & Women-Owned Business Enterprise (M/WBE) gives you exclusive access to opportunities to sell to government, networking events, inclusion in the City's Online Directory of Certified Businesses and offers many other benefits.
Join us for a workshop that will walk you through the process for completing your M/WBE application. Total course hours: 1 session, 2 hours.
You will learn about:

Getting certified as an M/WBE with New York City, New York State, NYC School Construction Authority, and The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
Applying for a vendor number and get notified of government opportunities in your industry

Working with an account manager to review your application for completeness before submitting it to an analyst for approval


* Please note that you will be emailed the login details upon completion and return of intake form.

event_description:
Business Support Center Information Session! 
Come and meet the team at the Small Business Support Center (SBSC).  This is your opportunity to gain answers to any question you have to start or operate a small business in NYC.
 The SBSC was created to be a one-stop location where businesses interact with several city agencies; Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, Department of Consumer Affairs, and the Department of Small Business Services.
 The SBSC serves as a the various needs of the small business community all in one easy access location.
 Some of the services at the SBSC include assistance with obtaining financing, arranging pro-bono legal consultations, assistance with staffing, training courses, insight into city rules, scheduling of inspections, obtaining certification to secure city contracts, apply and/or renew licenses and permits, and pay DOHMH, and DCA fines, and much more.
 So join us and tap the vast knowledge of our team!
event_name: Business Support Center Information Session, Queens, 9/13/2017

event_description:
Meet the Lenders Series – Dime/Celtic/Spring Bank
One of the most challenging issues for small business owners is finding the much needed capital to grow their business.
Finding the right source of capital that is best suited for you and your business needs is both vital and challenging. There are a multitude of variables involved and it can be overwhelming to get started on your own.
That is why we are giving you the opportunity to meet with lenders.
In September, you will hear from Dime Savings Bank, Celtic Bank, and Spring Bank, on how they can assist small business access much needed capital to start or grow their business.  They will discuss not only their lending capabilities but also other business banking services, such as credit cards, lines of credit, checking account, e-commerce and more.
Attendees will also have the opportunity to speak with the banks one-on-one.  Join us for this very insightful program.
event_name: Meet the Lenders: Dime/Celtic/Spring Banks, Queens, 9/14/17

Small Business Digital Marketing 
Looking to jumpstart your sales? Our digital marketing wizard will teach you how to attract and keep customers!

event_description:
Signing a Commercial Lease: What You Need to Know
Learn how to negotiate a fair commercial lease!
Business owners know that securing the right commercial space is an important decision, but many are not prepared to enter the lease negotiation process. By effectively negotiating a lease agreement before signing it, small business owners can avoid costly mistakes in the future. This course offers useful steps you can take to prepare for negotiating a commercial lease that serves your interests and minimizes risks. The course instructors are attorneys who have counseled both landlords and tenants on lease agreements and can share practical strategies for success.
You will learn about:

How to negotiate your lease term and build exit strategies into the lease
How to avoid signing “form” leases that favor the landlord
What strategies you can use to limit personal liability
What to look for in the permitted use provision
event_name: Signing a Commercial Lease: What You Need to Know,Brooklyn 9/20/2017

event_description:
Take advantage of Kiva Crowdfunding to access capital to grow your business!
Kiva is a non-profit that now offers 0% interest loans up to $10,000 for New York City businesses.
Rather than assessing your credit history and financial statements, Kiva uses your character and trust network as a measure of creditworthiness. If you are looking for capital in the next 30-60 days to start or expand your business, you should attend this Workshop.  
You will learn about:


How Kiva works, terms & conditions


The benefits of Kiva


How to market & manage your campaign


Best practices


Total course hours - 2

event_description:
Jumpstart Your Business – Obtain Small business Financing Through This Unique Workshop Opportunity
For small businesses, access to capital is one of the primary barriers to growth. In recent years, some entrepreneurs have turned to "crowdfunding" to bring their business ideas to the next level. But not everyone has an extensive personal network to market their fundraising campaign.
The NYC Business Solutions: “Jumpstart your Business” workshop guides entrepreneurs towards capital with no interest, fees, or credit score requirements. NYC Business Solutions does so by collaborating with Kiva Zip, a non-profit organization, which functions as a hybrid version of a crowdfunding and microfinance platform. By ‘registering’ for this event, you are expressing interest in applying to be a part of this workshop. 
In this class you will: 

Learn about kiva zip
Have time to plan or take a compelling photo
Receive tips and tricks for having a successful campaign.
Have opportunity after the info session to put together a kiva zip story and get feedback
event_name: Kiva Zip Bootcamp – Obtain Small Business Financing Through This Unique Workshop Opportunity, Brooklyn 9/28/17
